section.title: Downloading the Jars
section.para: Jetty is decomposed into many [[Jetty/Reference/Dependencies|jars and dependencies]] //TODO xref//to achieve a minimal footprint by selecting the minimal set of jars. Typically it is best to use something like Maven to manage jars this tutorial uses an aggregate Jar that contains all of the Jjetty classes in one Jar.

You can manually download the jetty aggregate-all Jar and the servlet api Jar using
wget or similar command (for example,
curl ) or a browser. Use wget as follows:
section.screen: mkdir Demo cd Demo JETTY_VERSION=7.0.2.v20100331 wget -U none http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/eclipse/jetty/aggregate/jetty-all/$JETTY_VERSION/jetty-all-$JETTY_VERSION.jar wget -U none http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/javax/servlet/servlet-api/2.5/servlet-api-2.5.jar
